intro: Tetrapterys adenodon, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Tetrapterys adenodon is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
